channel.title: Referring a random int to a variable. Good god, help me please

item.title: Referring a random int to a variable. Good god, help me please
item.dc:creator: @PatScape PatScape
item.description:
@PatScape wrote:

Ok. What I want to do is create a random int, which I did.

[code]/*public static int Spider[] = {1, 1, 2, 2, 2};

public static int randomSpider()
{
	return Spider[(int)(Math.random()*Spider.length)];
}*/	[/code]

Ok. theres my random INT.
So, I want to refer the 1 and the 2 to a seperate variable. EX:

if (randomSpider() = 1 { variable(); } else if (randomSpider() = 2) { otherVariable(); }
Ok. of course that doesnt work, but thatâ€™s the concept. Now, If i put

randomSpider();

in public boolean process, will that define it to a different random variable ever 500ms?

Read full topic
